headline: Turkey and Quinoa Meatloaf
description: The secret ingredient in this flavorful turkey meatloaf is quinoa. Quinoa is nuttier than breadcrumbs and improves the texture of the meatloaf.

video.description: It’s the secret to turkey meatloaf with the perfect texture.
video.name: Turkey and Quinoa Meatloaf

name: Turkey and Quinoa Meatloaf

recipeInstructions.text: Bring the quinoa and water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the quinoa is tender, and the water has been absorbed, about 15 to 20 minutes. Set aside to cool.
Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in the onion; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for another minute; remove from heat to cool.

Stir the turkey, cooked quinoa, onions, tomato paste, hot sauce, 2 tablespoons Worcestershire, egg, salt, and pepper in a large bowl until well combined. The mixture will be very moist. Shape into a loaf on a foil lined baking sheet. Combine the brown sugar, 2 teaspoons Worcestershire, and 1 teaspoon water in a small bowl. Rub the paste over the top of the meatloaf.

Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, about 50 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Let the meatloaf cool for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

review.reviewBody: It was so awesome! This has become my new #1 meatloaf to go to. Loved it and made as stated. I am not a big vegetable eater however, I used my chopper to chop some carrots and string beans up fine, added them to the onions and garlic before adding them to the turkey. Added them to the turkey and baked. They didn’t change the flavor but an easy way for me to get my veggies. I used about a 1/2 cup of each.

Wow! This was bomb! The whole family, from age (picky & 5) 8, 14 and both adults all loved this recipe. They even went back for seconds. You def made me look good ;). I doubled the recipe-took out the hot sauce, and subbed it for bbq.. used a lil less brown sugar for the topping and hit it with a bit of liquid smoke…soo good! Definitely adding it to the rotation. Thanks a ton !

I made this with some hesitancy, but we absolutely loved the final result. I had to make some changes based on what we had on hand. I didn't have garlic or onions, so it was essentially turkey, quinoa, cheese (1/2C (60g) - I wanted some, not a lot) and spices. In addition to the recipe, I added quite a bit of onion and garlic powder, a touch of cumin, used one tablespoon of barbecue sauce in place of the hot pepper sauce, and since I didn't have tomato paste, I used one tablespoon of pasta sauce. I also rubbed a thin layer of barbecue sauce on the outside instead of the rub. I was worried the barbecue sauce (Montgomery Inn) would overwhelm, but it didn't. I also cooked the quinoa in water with a chicken bouillon cube, and the one egg was plenty. Shaped it as suggested, plopped it into the center of a 9x13 dish, and 50 minutes later we had an extremely tasty, yet healthy, meatloaf! Thanks so much for the recipe, the quinoa really makes it!
I add siracha sauce, tasted good although I may have a bit too much. I'll definitely make it again!
Always a favorite in my household! I make this recipe as is, and it turns out wonderfully each time. It’s never dry, and it is very flavorful. Eating healthy is delicious!
Very easy to make. Husband loved it!
delicious, no hot sauce
This was really good! Looking at the reviews, I used 2 eggs and halved the hot sauce. Will definitely make again!

I don’t review recipes very often, because I have to modify them due to nightshade allergies. Still, this recipe too good not to rate. I had to leave out the tomato paste and hot sauce, but the flavor and texture of the meatloaf was fantastic. I really liked the Worcestershire and brown sugar rub. I also added a chopped zucchini while sautéing the onion and garlic, a handful of fresh chopped basil, and a tablespoon of fresh chopped rosemary. I’m definitely going to be making this again!

Perfect healthy meatloaf! We didn't miss the breadcrumbs at all and felt so much better after eating this meatloaf as opposed to normal meatloaves. I have made this exactly according to the recipe with success. This time I couldn't believe I ran out of tomato paste so I had to substitute with tomato sauce (3TBSP) which seemed to work well. I added an extra egg since I felt it might need extra binding. Also, left off the topping and made the mushroom gravy from this website. I used cornstarch to thicken to make it gluten free. My husband was over the moon about this meal!

This is my go to recipe for turkey meatloaf!!! It is the best! My family loves it. I make it accordingly to the recipe, the only thing I change is the sauce on top. I use one that I read in another review. It is 1/4 c brown sugar, 1/4 c ketchup, 1 tbsp mustard and a few shakes of Worcestershire sauce. So yummy.

This is one of our regular meals. The quinoa is a very good idea. Loaf stays together without the bread. 

Easy, quick to prepare and very tasty.
I already submitted a 5-star review. Really recommend this. Next time I'll make a double batch so I can have it the next day at work for lunch.

I have been making this recipe for about one year now. It’s my new go-to. My husband was highly skeptical about the deliciousness of any meatloaf, particularly of the turkey or chicken kind, and laughed at me when I read aloud to him the reviews of other husbands begging for more. He is now a believer and requests this often. He slices and makes it into meatloaf paninis, which he pushes on all of his friends and coworkers. The only changes I make is to use 1 pound of ground white chicken breast, extra garlic, and the following topping: 1/4 cup ketchup, 3 Tbls brown sugar, 1 heaping teaspoon ground mustard, and 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg. This is my grandmother’s piquant sauce recipe and is delicious. I am making this today, and have used date sugar instead of brown sugar. I’m sure it will be as tasty.
Recipe was easy to follow. The brown sugar and Worcestershire did not make a paste but that did not effect the flavor. It was delicious and we will make this again.
It was delicious - we all had seconds. I'll definitely make it again.
If you're expecting something similar to regular meatloaf, this isn't it. Still, it's pretty good. I think it would be improved with less hot sauce and additional flavoring such as herbs.

I have made this before in the oven but I just made it in the air fryer and yum!!! Much more moist. I added Knorr chicken seasoning and a few chopped up tomatoes to the meat mix. Air fry at 400 degrees for 20 min. Absolutely delicious!!! Poor sauce on top.

Wow ! So delicious . I doubled the recipe and it was more then plenty for dinner & leftover for lunches (family of 4 adults). I used siracha for the hot sauce , and catsup for the tomato paste( what i had on hand ). We all loved it .
Excellent.

I liked the texture and flavour. I added 1/4 cup oatmeal as well as the quinoa. I put the topping of ketchup, brown sugar, and Worcestershire on after baking 25 minutes. I think I would reduce hot sauce slightly next time.

Before trying this recipe, meatloaf was not something I made. I don't care for traditional meatloaf whether it is made with oatmeal, crackers, or breadcrumbs. However, I decided to try this recipe. OH MY!!! IT IS AMAZING! 

Instead of the tomato paste and hot sauce, I used 1 Tbsp. of BBQ sauce!
I’ve been making this meatloaf for years and it is excellent.
Didn't have tomato paste, used marinara which was fine. Also added some chia seeds.
Loved it! Didn’t change a thing. Very tasty! Followed exact

I've made this a recipe probably over a dozen times and it's always delicious! I usually lighten up on the hot sauce or completely exclude it when I make it for my kids otherwise, I change nothing. Delicious and healthy.
It was ok. The quinoa was good and gave me away to use up leftover quinoa. If I make again I’ll change up seasonings.

This was absolutely delicious! It was even better the next day on a meatloaf sandwich! For anyone skeptical about the quinoa you honestly cannot taste it at all in the meatloaf it merely serves as the breading to keep your meatloaf from falling apart?!!! Are used a box of the Mediterranean medley quinoa just to give it an extra boost a flavor!?

Wow! lots of flavor that my red-meat eating sweetie loved. Yes, he added ketchup.
I made the recipe exactly as listed.
Excellent!! This is my go-to meatloaf recipe. The only change I make is topping it with BBQ sauce before baking.
One of our favorite recipes!! The only change I make is to add tomato paste to the sauce & double the ingredients for the sauce.

My husband and I really liked this recipe. It is tasty and moist. 
I reduced the salt to 1 tsp and the hot pepper sauce to 1 1/2 tsp. Both were plenty. I think the full amount of salt and hot pepper sauce would have overwhelmed the meat flavor.
I also added some chopped sweet red pepper with the onions and garlic.

This recipe is wonderful!!! I substituted agave nectar instead of brown sugar and no onions or garlic. The quinoa substitute is a game changer for me. I will always use this recipe from now on!! I LOVE it!!! Thank you!
Delish! Added chopped mushrooms and some shredded carrots to the onion mixture. Definitely making again!
Best turkey loaf I'd had. Cut hot sauce to 1 tsp and topped with BBQ sauce, but otherwise followed recipe.
Always a crowd pleaser! Excellent recipe! One of my favorites to prepare. Absolutely delicious!

I'm not fan of meatloaf, especially turkey meatloaf, but this is excellent! Everyone in the house loves it, so I always make two loaves and freeze one before cooking it.

I make it as is, typically, but I've also tossed in additional leftover gains with excellent results. Lentils work out particularly well. 

Thanks for a fantastic recipe!
This recipe is amazing and one of my favorites of all time. My family and friends love the meatloaf. They all say it’s flavorful. The sweet and spicy together compliments the meatloaf.

Delicious! The quinoa gave this a nice hearty texture. I took some liberties with the recipe. Because I only had 1 lb. 85% lean ground turkey, I used a little bit more quinoa and added 3/4 cup chopped sautéed portobello mushrooms. I used red quinoa cooked with with 1/2 beef bone broth and 1/2 water. I subbed ketchup for tomato paste. I cut the salt by about 1/2 since the broth has salt, and omitted the brown sugar and hot sauce. I added chopped fresh rosemary and oregano. I mixed all ingredients together- nothing on top of the meatloaf. The mix was a bit too squishy, so I ended up adding a couple TBS breadcrumbs. I took others’ suggestions and baked them in a muffin tin (I oiled them first and filled 9 spots ), baked for 28 min one side, turned them out onto a cookie sheet, and baked for 3 more minutes. I will definitely make this again!

I have tried many ground turkey dishes and this is THEE best turkey meatloaf so far. I almost had given up on searching and am glad I didn't. I even omitted the hot sauce and brown sugar paste and it was still delicious. Since quinoa is generally pretty bland, I assume it is for binding purposes since the mixture is very moist. Bravo!
I've made this countless times since finding it about 5 years ago. the only meatloaf I make because it's simply the best I've ever had.. by far!
Delicious and Easy to make, I left the raw ingredients for my 12 yr old daughter to make while I was at work, we added potatoes around the meatloaf for a one pan meal.
Wife was pleasantly surprised. Delicious!! Thank you!!

I have made a lot of meatloaf over the years--beef and turkey, my own recipes and those of others--and this is my (and my family's) favorite! It's easy, very flavorful, and as healthy as meatloaf can be. I follow the recipe as written with two minor changes: I saute some diced celery with the onion, and I add a couple of tablespoons of ketchup, a teaspoon of mustard, and a pinch of cloves to the brown sugar/Worchestershire glaze, as that's the way my mom did it when I was growing up.

I made this recipe using ground chicken. I reduced the hot sauce and black pepper. Also, because I made into 5 individual meat loaves, I reduced the cooking time to 40 minutes.
These meatloaves had alot of flavor, but did come little bit dry. Also, my family missed the traditional ketchup topping we usually have on a meatloaf.

Easy recipe and very tasty! Only modification I made was to add a few tsp of Dijon mustard and a larger onion. After done, sliced into thirds and broiled it for a few minutes to make it crispy on top. Hi hanks for the recipe!!
This is a nice hearty meal good served with sweet potatoes. I substitute the tomato paste with ketchup since I don't usually have tomato paste in the cupboard.

This is amazing. We had to cook it in small loaf pans but everyone loved that they got their own. Plus even my two boys with sensory issues & one is Autistic. He's VERY picky & texture is huge! Thank you.

One of the best recipes I’ve tried for Turkey Meatloaf! I used Siracha in place of traditional hot sauce and it was so good! I never would have thought to add quinoa in, that was such a great addition. Thank you!

Made it twice so far and a few things I noted:

The type/quality of quinoa changes the flavor. If you think it's flavorless, I'd look for a different brand of quinoa. 
Bone broth or chicken broth adds flavor for cooking the quinoa. 
I did it in muffin tins, and they turned out perfectly with consistency. 
Do the hot sauce as optional, or pay attention to the brand. Different brands have different levels of spice. I personally only to 1/2 the amount of it listed.
Cooked Quinoa in beef broth instead of water. Also added 1 tablespoon of Italian seasoning. Omitted the hot sauce. Was flavorful and would make again.

This meatloaf is amazing! I wasn't sure if I should review it, because I had to substitute couscous for the quinoa (couldn't find it at the store due to the pandemic). I kept everything else the same, and I will definitely make this again!
I have made this over and over again! Oftentimes I add in some more veggies (sauteed mushrooms/zucchini) as it is a very accommodating recipe. Thanks, Drew!

Added 1 small grated zucchini for extra veggies for the kids! It was greatly appreciated by all 6 family members- even my pickiest eater that eats almost no meat because of the texture !! Will do again!!
Excellent meatloaf
Was a little dry, could just be mine though. Paired really well with baked beans and green beans! Liked the glaze on top of the meat loaf.
This is a family favorite!
I make this often and it is delicious. Makes for nice leftovers for sandwiches too.
Very moist and tasty. I added a second egg and left out the hot sauce. I only used 1 tsp salt but would reduce to 1/2 tsp next time.
Loved it

I made this recipe last night and it was awesome! During this pandemic, ground beef is scarce, but I was able to get some ground turkey. I do use it a lot but it takes quite a bit of extra help sometimes. This recipe really hit it! Very flavorful and held together. I didn't even cook it as meatloaf, but used a spoon to dollop into a pan for meatloaf burgers! Just spray your pan down well. As per the tips, I used 2 eggs and added some shredded cheese, but didn't have any quinoa. I used lentils that I softened in vegetable broth. So still got the nutty flavor, plus more protein and fiber. I just had some as a cold sandwich for lunch. Yum! Thank you
Loved it, but I changed it up a bit. 400f, bread pan, sauce on bottom and top, tapatio sauce, and ketchup instead of tomato paste. Also i doubled the recipe. Turned out great.

My family usually likes lighter fare, but this was one they asked me to not repeat. I did use the leanest ground turkey, so maybe that's why it was a little dry. They ate it, and I enjoyed the leftovers, it just wasn't a keeper for us.
I will make it again! I cooked myTri Color Quinoa in chicken broth . Yum!

First time, I followed the directions and liked the kick of the hot pepper sauce (Tabasco). 2nd time, I took the suggestion of using BBQ sauce in lieu of the hot pepper sauce from CRS943, and enjoyed it as well. Love this recipe as it uses quinoa, and ingredients are flexible. Thank you Mr. Benoit for posting.

Instead of a loaf, I cooked it as burgers--fried in a non-stick skillet. Omitted the onion, brown sugar, and hot sauce. Substituted ketchup for the tomato paste and water. Very moist & tasty. So easy and quick too.
Yummy!! I kept the recipe as is.
Great recipe and very helpful comments. As suggested, an extra egg and some flower really helped the meat bind. Delish!
I was skeptical but this was super good as written. Thank you!
Loooooved it!! I substituted 1 tbls of tomate paste and 1 tbls hot pepper sauce for two tbls of chipolatas in adobe sauce (minus the seeds) Yummy twist.

I’m going to be honest, I kept my expectations really low with this one because I’m not the biggest fan of ground turkey or quinoa. But I am absolutely ecstatic with the results. I shared it with my fitness group and my best friends because other people need to know about this. I followed the recipe mostly as written, taking a tip from other reviewers and adding the extra egg. I also made a spur of the moment decision to mince and add a jalapeño for a spicy surprise. Absolutely going to make this again ! Thank you so much for sharing !
Amazing recipe, the all family loved it !

Came out really nice. I tweaked it a bit, because I can't help myself...lol. Used "Jump Up and Kiss Me" hot sauce because we love the flavor and aren't fond of Franks, and added some "Cajun Garlic" sauce as well (Tbsp of JUKM and Cajun both). Also added another clove of garlic. Will definitely make again. Thanks!

Came out really nice. I tweaked it a bit, because I can't help myself...lol. Used "Jump Up and Kiss Me" hot sauce because we love the flavor and aren't fond of Franks, and added some "Cajun Garlic" sauce as well (Tbsp of JUKM and Cajun both). Also added another clove of garlic. Will definitely make again. Thanks!
This is a family favorite! It also freezes very well. Thank you for a such a healthy and great tasting recipe!
This meatloaf was kinda bland. The quinoa was cooked in chicken broth to add flavor. I left off the sweet paste because I don't like sweet food....it was moist however ...
I tripled it and added cauliflower rice and mushrooms and an extra egg like the other reviewers did. Over all it turned out great.

Really good! Added 1 extra egg and shook in some panko to help as it was a little loose. Shook in some cheddar cheese but probably doesn't need it, couldn't notice it. I subbed sweet chili sauce for the hot sauce, and subbed ketchup for the tomato paste (rather than open a can for this little amt.). 
For the topping I did 1/4 C. br. sugar, 1/4 C. ketchup, 1 T. mustard and added some worcestershire.) 
I put it on a PAM sprayed, foil lined sheet (used one that had sides). Formed it into a rectangle.

Looking for healthier dinner options that are dairy and gluten free and this was AMAZING!!! After eating so many salads this was just the healthy comfort food I needed!! We paired it with sweet potatoes and French green beans....DELICIOUS!

First I confess to changing the recipe little. I doubled the batch but mixed turkey and ground beef. I also added mushrooms. I didn't have tomato paste so I used catsup. I loved it, but, with the recipe as-is, we found it too salty. I would cut back on the Worcestershire a little as well as the salt. Still, it had a wonderful taste. I shaped it on a cookie sheet as suggested.
Wonderful as is! Will definitely make it again and I won't be changing a thing....except to make a double batch!
Generally good, but lacking in a way I can't put my finger on.
Very moist and flavorful. I made it with half the salt; next time I'll make it with half the brown sugar.

My daughter and I tried this recipe. It was very good. We enjoyed it very much. My husband who is not a big ground turkey fan didn't even realize it wasn't beef. I will definitely use this recipe again.
Amazingly good and easy to do, this recipe is now one of my go-to healthy meals
Outstanding! Even my picky eater grandson loved it! Got requests to be sure and make it again!

I did make some changes. I used almost all of the small can of tomato paste, eliminated the hot sauce and made a sauce for the top with the rest of the can of tomato paste, brown sugar and worcestershire sauce. I didn't add the sauce while baking, just added it over the top of the meatloaf when serving.

I know the reviews are from several years ago, but this is my go to meatloaf. We don’t eat beef, so turkey meatloaf is what we like. The addition of quinoa instead of bread crumbs makes It quite moist.Easy, quick, and very good. I make his a couple times a month.
I added a little bit of red, green, and orange bell pepper, and it made all the difference! So tasty, definitely making this again.
This was very good. It was light and flavorful. I made it without the hot sauce, just as a matter of preference and it was still very tasty.
Fine right after I made it, excellent the next 2 days. I added an extra egg, but followed everything else exactly.

Turned out great! Reduced hot sauce to 1 tsp. Used veggie bullion in the quinoa cooking process. Added yellow peppers. Made (2) 1-lb loaves from all dark meat that I cooked on a raised rack with perforated parchment paper. To do this, I put parchment paper on a cooking rack and used a fork to poke drain holes. Placed rack on a pan and put loaves on top of the paper. Great texture and flavor!

Holy this was delicious! The sauce on top proved a little aggressive but still good, and I accidentally put in double the quinoa - still came out absolutely tasty, and was a huge hit with my household.

Just made this and the fam loved it! My two sensitive pallets didn’t even realize the hot sauce was in it. Next time round I’ll make a more “traditional” glaze to go on top. We cooked ours in the smoker for about 45 min. The quinoa was a great addition that added to the consistency, so much so that it but perfectly and was way more easy to serve up than our regular meatloaf (a ground beef/sausage mix). I believe we’ve found our go to.
Fantastic! I will definitely be making this again
Very good, substituted bbq sauce for topping
Great base will make again and play with flavours. The free form was new too me and makes such a positive difference. I also loved the addition of quinoa. Thanks for great recipe
We made it as is, but, next time I'd cut back on hot sauce to 1 tsp.
Super good and easy to make. I made a topping with some tomato paste, brown sugar and Worcestershire sauce. Super good!
